column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
An isle surveyor is searching for an assistant.
Speak with the isle surveyor.
Use the destructive magick concept on the rocky outcrop.
Retrieve the ore fragments.
Deliver the ore fragments to the isle surveyor.
Speak with the isle surveyor.
Would you assist me, familiar?
As I'm sure you are aware, the floating islands of Elpis were created to provide suitable habitats for our various creations.
In order to maintain their respective environments, however, surveyors such as myself must make regular assessments of their aetherial composition.

To that end, I was planning to take samples from the melanion habitat with my partner, but it seems he had an urgent engagement. Something about an unscheduled meeting with a member of the Convocation of Fourteen...
Though I'm now faced with handling this rather grueling task alone, waiting until he returns is simply not an option. As I said, it's important to gather data at regular, specific intervals.
And thus am I requesting your help. So, what say you? Would you be willing to accompany me in place of my partner?
What will you say?
Certainly.
I don't know...
Many thanks! I'll be sure to reward you for your efforts.
Please! I'll make it worth your while. The samples <Emphasis>must</Emphasis> be taken at the right time!
Right, let's hurry along, then. We'll need to make our way to the south.
The rocks in this area contain ores that can tell us about the environmental aether. We'll have to break them apart with destructive magicks to collect the necessary samples.
You may find that difficult with your inherent...limitations, but I have a little something to help with that.
Here, use this concept crystal to shatter an outcrop of rock, then bring any ore fragments back to me.
Start in the east, if you would. I'll start working elsewhere, and we can meet back here.
How did you fare?
Excellent. This should give me all the information I need. Let's head back, shall we?
Thank you. Without your aid, I wouldn't have been able to properly observe how the introduction of melanioi has affected their habitat's aether.
It's important to keep careful track of the environments here to make any necessary adjustments.
The terrain, the flora, everything that makes up the habitat must be meticulously controlled to fit each subject under observation.
Though I applaud my partner's enthusiasm for learning at the foot of a Convocation member, we cannot neglect these fundamental─albeit tedious─facets of our work.
